ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a broad appreciation for the history of psychology. I learned the many ways in which psychologists were mistaken about things in the past.

It gave me time to think about some of the interesting historical developments and shifts the field has seen, and to consider how these are relevant to our current work, in terms of both research and clinical practice.
I gained a broader historical perspective on clinical psychology and gained valuable experience presenting a clinical case.
-The history and contexts of various controversies and concepts in psychology

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of the course were that it was very efficient, conveying core details without "fluff." The discussion-based classes were really helpful in making the material engaging.
I really liked the format of this course in its present form and I strongly support keeping it like this in future years.

The workload of the course was perfect (not too much but just enough so that we could come prepared to discuss the topics/papers we had been assigned). I liked the reading response posts because they allowed us to formulate our thinking about readings. The readings (mix of popular articles and academic journal articles) prompted us to think about how these issues apply to the broader world outside of psychology. I also like that the faculty was rotating! Jutta's week was especially excellent.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to a student who was required to take it, yes.
Would absolutely recommend to fulfill APA requirement!
Definitely recommended for knowledge on the background/contexts of key concepts in the field
